The sysapproval_approver table has a column called sysapproval. This is populated for approvals related to task records. But for non task records, you need to look at source_table and document_id. The sysapproval column is called "Approval for" while document_id is called "Approving" in the UI. So, you would have to customize the UI as well.
What's the firmware version of the new PBX? Need to know before I approve the change.
Has anyone successfully upgraded the firmware on a #MacBook Air? I'm on Leopard. SSD storage.
We haven't patched the firmware. The box ships with 2.7.39.
#Lync is more difficult to use. We need Live Feed for easier tagging and following. Plus, groups in Live Feed rock! Thanks IT!

Ah, try deselecting "Use SSL to connect" in Tools -> Accounts.

TIDE login is not directly integrated with single sign-on. You still need to use your old password.

Is your custom table a task extension? If not, then there are some additional steps required but I don't know on top of my head what needs to be done.
Make sure you're using the latest Cisco #VPN client. I'm on AnyConnect 3.4. No issues with #SSO offsite.

@[e39511210a0a3c6d00ef8620582702f1:ITIL User], you might have used the same password when you joined the company. We see this with new employees all the time a few months after they join the company. Thanks for using live feed to get your issue resolved.
Thank you. This is exactly what I was looking for!
Excellent idea! So much easier to use and we already use it for everything else.

Haven't noticed anything in Building 'S'

Live Feed provides a place to post and share content in a ServiceNow instance. This content forms a searchable knowledge source for sharing information within an organization.
		- Users can post, reply to, and rate messages, including links and
		images.
		- Administrators can set up automatic messages that are generated when
		specific records are updated throughout the system.
		- Users can subscribe to receive #email notifications when new
		messages are posted.
The service desk is getting SLAMMED with complaints about the #email system. The problem management team is on it now...more to come...
UPDATE: Everywhere but buildings 'S' and 'P' are affected...still working on it
Thanks, that worked. Before resetting my password, I could use the single sign-on password though.
Thanks Taylor. That was the issue. AT&T was using a radio frequency that scrambled our WiFi. They've shift frequencies. Can you confirm access is restored?
